metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1068 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux 4.x kernel's implementation of 32-bit syscallinterface for bridging. This allowed a privileged user to arbitrarily writeto a limited range of kernel memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-13.14
